1457.62.text:
We need to get to
this last question.

1461.29.text:
It says, "My tomato plant leaves
are turning brown and dying from

1466.70.text:
"the bottom to the
top of the plant.

1471.80.text:
If you don't have your tomatoes
under a regular program.

1473.81.text:
And if you did this
year with us getting rain,

1475.81.text:
you probably still
have trouble with blight.

1477.81.text:
Some of the varieties are a
little more resistant than

1481.01.text:
But if you got a problem, I
would make sure I go out there

1483.02.text:
and spray with
chlorothalonil or Mancozeb.

1486.75.text:
There are a couple of the
fungicides that are recommended.

1489.49.text:
I know chlorothalonil has
a zero day waiting period.

1492.16.text:
So, I'd give it
seven to ten days.

1498.73.text: Be sure to connect with us.

1500.03.text:
We'll send you weekly e-mail
updates about "Family Plot."

1506.21.text:
and sign up under
"Get Local Show Updates."

1513.25.text:
You can also follow us
on Facebook and Twitter.

1517.15.text:
That's all we
have time for today.

1521.15.text:
Be sure to join 
us next time for

1522.35.text:
"The Family Plot:
Gardening in the Mid-South."

1556.92.text:
"The Family Plot: Gardening in
the Mid-South" is provided by

1561.09.text:
Good Winds Landscape and Garden
Center, in Germantown since 1943

1565.56.text:
and continuing to offer its
plants for successful gardening

1568.93.text:
with seven greenhouses
and three acres of plants.
